v.v: The Song of Songs, which is Solomon’s.
Oh, that he would kiss me with the kisses of his mouth,
Your anointing oils have a delightful fragrance;
Take me with you, and we will run.
I am dark but lovely,
Do not stare at me because I am dark,
Tell me, you whom my soul loves,
If you do not know, most beautiful among women,
I compare you, my love,
Your cheeks are beautiful with ornaments,
We will make for you gold ornaments
While the king lay on his couch,
My beloved is to me like a bag of myrrh
My beloved is to me like a cluster of henna flowers
Listen, you are beautiful, my love;
Listen, you are handsome, my beloved, how handsome.
The beams of our house are cedars;
I am a meadow flower of Sharon,
As a lily among thorns,
As an apricot tree among the trees of the forest,
He brought me to the house of wine,
Revive me with raisin cakes and refresh me with apricots,
His left hand is under my head,
I want you to swear, daughters of Jerusalem,
There is the sound of my beloved! Listen, here he comes,
My beloved is like a gazelle or a young stag;
My beloved spoke to me and said,
Look, the winter is past;
The flowers have appeared in the land;
The fig tree ripens her green figs,
My dove, in the clefts of the rock,
Catch the foxes for us, the little foxes
My beloved is mine, and I am his;
Go away, my beloved,
At night on my bed
I said to myself, “I will get up and go through the city,
The watchmen found me as they were making their rounds in the city.
It was only a little while after I had passed them
I want you to swear, daughters of Jerusalem,
What is that coming up from the wilderness
Look, it is the bed of Solomon;
All of them are skilled with a sword and are experienced in warfare.
King Solomon made himself a sedan chair
Its posts were made of silver;
Go out, daughters of Zion, and gaze on King Solomon,
Oh, you are beautiful, my love; you are beautiful.
Your teeth are like a flock of newly shorn ewes,
Your lips are like a thread of scarlet;
Your neck is like the tower of David built in rows of stone,
Your two breasts are like two fawns,
Until the dawn arrives and the shadows flee away,
You are beautiful in every way, my love
Come with me from Lebanon, my bride.
You have stolen my heart, my sister, my bride;
How beautiful is your love, my sister, my bride!
Your lips, my bride, drip honey;
My sister, my bride is a garden locked up,
Your branches are a grove of pomegranate trees with choice fruits,
Nard and saffron,
You are a garden spring,
Awake, north wind; come, south wind;
I have come into my garden, my sister, my bride;
I was asleep, but my heart was awake.
“I have taken off my robe; must I put it on again?
My beloved put in his hand through the opening of the door latch,
I got up to open the door for my beloved;
I opened the door for my beloved,
The watchmen found me as they were making their rounds in the city.
I want you to swear, daughters of Jerusalem,
How is your beloved better than another beloved man,
My beloved is radiant and ruddy,
His head is the purest gold;
His eyes are like doves beside streams of water,
His cheeks are like beds of spices,
His arms are rounded gold set with jewels;
His legs are pillars of marble, set on bases of pure gold;
His mouth is most sweet;
Where has your beloved gone,
My beloved has gone down to his garden,
I am my beloved’s, and my beloved is mine;
You are as beautiful as Tirzah, my love,
Turn your eyes away from me,
Your teeth are like a flock of ewes
Your cheeks are like pomegranate halves
There are sixty queens, eighty concubines,
My dove, my undefiled, is the only one;
“Who is this who appears like the dawn,
I went down into the grove of nut trees
I was so happy that I felt
Turn back, turn back, you perfect woman;
How beautiful your feet appear in your sandals, prince’s daughter!
Your navel is like a round bowl;
Your two breasts are like two fawns,
Your neck is like a tower of ivory;
Your head is on you like Carmel;
How beautiful and how lovely you are,
Your height is like that of a date palm tree,
I said, “I want to climb that palm tree;
May your palate be like the best wine,
I am my beloved’s,
Come, my beloved, let us go out into the countryside;
Let us rise early to go to the vineyards;
The mandrakes give off their fragrance;
I wish that you were like my brother,
I would lead you and bring you into my mother’s house—
His left hand is under my head
I want you to swear, daughters of Jerusalem,
Who is this who is coming up from the wilderness,
Set me as a seal over your heart,
Surging waters cannot quench love,
We have a little sister,
If she is a wall,
I was a wall, but my breasts are now like fortress towers;
Solomon had a vineyard at Baal Hamon.
My vineyard, my very own, is before me;
You who live in the gardens,
Hurry, my beloved,

v: for your love is better than wine.
your name is like flowing perfume,
so the young women love you.
The king has brought me into his rooms.
We are glad; We rejoice about you;
let us celebrate your love; it is better than wine.
It is natural for the other women to adore you.
you daughters of Jerusalem—
dark like the tents of Kedar,
lovely like the curtains of Solomon.
because the sun has scorched me.
My mother’s sons were angry with me;
they made me keeper of the vineyards,
but my own vineyard I have not kept.
where do you feed your flock?
Where do you rest your flock at noontime?
Why should I be like someone who wanders
beside the flocks of your companions?
follow the tracks of my flock,
and pasture your young goats near the shepherds’ tents.
